questions.question_text: In your organization there are rules and procedures that the program manager must follow and abide by before the program can begin and must continue to follow once the program is in execution. What term is assigned to the enforcement of these program management rules and procedures?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Organizational process assets - plans, processes, policies, procedures and knowledge bases that are specific to and used by the performing organization.

Seems most correct based on the context of the question.

Selected Answer: A
A. Program Governance.

Program governance involves the frameworks, functions, and processes that guide program activities, ensuring compliance with internal and external requirements, standards, and strategic objectives. It includes oversight, decision-making, and accountability mechanisms established by the organization to ensure that programs are well managed and aligned with organizational goals and strategies. Governance provides a structured way to control and monitor the program's processes, manage risks, and ensure that the program delivers the intended value and benefits.

questions.question_text: You are the program manager of the MQQ Program. Your program will use equipment and materials that are new to your industry. You have some concerns that there will be delays and waste by your program team because they've not worked with these materials or tools before. You elect to send the resources that will work the most with these tools through training. The cost of the training in this instance is known as which one of the following?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Cost of Conformance to Quality.

The Cost of Conformance to Quality encompasses the expenses incurred to ensure that the product or service meets quality requirements. This includes costs for prevention activities, like training, which are aimed at preventing defects and errors. In your case, the training is a preventative measure to ensure that the team can effectively and efficiently work with the new materials and tools, thereby adhering to quality standards and reducing the likelihood of delays and waste due to inexperience. Therefore, it fits well within the concept of the Cost of Conformance to Quality.

questions.question_text:
Over the life of your program you've received many change request forms. Some of the change requests have been approved and some have been declined.
Where should you record all change requests and their status?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Change Log.

A Change Log is a document used in project and program management to track and record all change requests, including their description, status (whether they are approved, declined, or pending), and any other relevant details. It serves as a historical record of all requested changes throughout the lifecycle of the program, providing transparency and traceability. This log is essential for effective change management and helps in maintaining an organized approach to handling changes.

comments.content: I concur. It should be change log indeed.

discussion.content: it must be Change log , there is no term of change register in SPM
